definition: (literary) to offer food and drinks/to entertain
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
for the benefit of the reader
variant of 宴饗|宴飨[yan4 xiang3]
to host a banquet/feast/banquet/ceremony of sacrifice
I beg you to partake of this sacrifice (used at the end of an elegiac address)
variant of 宴饗|宴飨[yan4 xiang3]
to host a banquet/feast/banquet/ceremony of sacrifice
to close the door in one's face (idiom)
to enjoy offered food and drink

sentences.english: In this manner, they stroll through the city making music, serenading locals and tourists alike.
sentences.chinese: 他们以这种方式巡回全市，奏乐以飨当地居民和游客。

sentences.english: The guests were entertained with all kinds of delicacies.
sentences.chinese: 客人们被飨以各种佳肴。

sentences.english: Some of them are presented here for you.
sentences.chinese: 在此呈现部分以飨诸位。

sentences.english: For promoting the application of Zhongjing formula, the author tried to share his experience with others.
sentences.chinese: 为推广仲景方的应用，提供个人经验，以飨同道。

sentences.english: They were regaled with tea and cakes.
In order to satisfy the audience's treat, and decided to play yesterday and then went on to say.
sentences.chinese: 为了以飨观众的眼福，决定接着继续说昨天的剧本。

sentences.english: Treats are great in moderation, but moderation is the key word.
sentences.chinese: 在现代化的宴飨都非常美味，但是现代化才是根源。

definition: to look forward eagerly/to long for
(of distinguished guest) honor my house (firm etc) with your presence
wine offered to gods in worship
therefore/consequently/thus/hence/thereupon/it follows that/where?/to change (into)/ancient unit of weight and money
then/at once/always/(archaic) luggage rack on a chariot
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
